snippet: Answering the American Community Survey is the civic duty of everyone, yet some House Republicans seem to think it should be voluntary. That would make the survey’s data useless.
abstract: Editorial opposes Republican proposal that would make it voluntary to participate in the Census Bureau's American Community Survey, change that would make data less reliable if not useless; warns that bill means choosing ideology over facts and bias over rights.
lead_paragraph: Answering the American Community Survey is the civic duty of everyone, yet some House Republicans seem to think it should be voluntary. That would make the survey’s data useless.
